page.title: 01Main Features of our Area
page.content: The area is rural, made up of two villages: Gt.Maplestead and Wickham St.Paul and including parts of two bordering villages Lt.Maplestead and Gestingthorpe. The only remaining village school is in Gt.Maplestead. Houses are mixed in character and ages. There are many timber framed houses, some thatched. More modern properties blend well with the rural appearance and atmosphere of the villages. The population of Wickham St.Paul is 271, that of Gt.Maplestead is 317.Two churches are in the area: St.Giles in Gt.Maplestead and St.John's in Lt.Maplestead. The main crops grown are wheat, barley, sugar beet and oil seed rape. Some cattle and sheep are kept and partridges and pheasants are bred for shooting.
